雖然舉黃傘好左膠，但係人地冒住風險係共產國家支持我地香港民主運動
所以大家要繼續撑落去!!!

最後佢地寫咗首詩送比我地
My dearest,
The fire has ignited upon the universities’ courtyard in Hong Kong,
Innocent faces, blood has stained the children that did nothing wrong,
Many of these young ones, beaten, assassinated, and forced to die…
They have written their final letters before listening to the elders asking why.

My dearest, it is painful to witness our children in the midst pepper sprays, water blasters and poisons…
Are you asking them to give up? Or are you asking them to fight for the right reason,
To live but to be humiliated; to be cowardice; to be irresponsible; to not give a fuck…then what is death?
Seeing the children beaten, I cannot bear it,
But they fight for freedom, so in their lives, they can bare it.
I only ask of them to take care and protect themselves,
Try to maneuver the enemy punches and overcoming the self.

I will cry each day because I miss them dearly,
But we are proud despite our weary,
For they have lived a life in full,
For the rest of the unfair world, they also pull.

The children of Hong Kong are writing their story,
With just bare hands against Chinese weaponry,
These children are writing history in blood,
A glorifying part for the future to bud.

None of us can account for the time of the angels, my dearest,
They come and go, happiness they bless,
They scatter the seeds of love, of hope, and freedom,
Only in heaven, these young ones can immortalize in their own kingdom.

Don’t cry my dearest, don’t you cry,
We shall march along their sides without asking why,
By holding hands, we are weaving a fortress,
Barricading our civilization against those dictatorial fools, we must do our best.

My dearest,
Take my hands firmly,
Shall we march with our children strongly?

My dearest,
The fire has ignited upon the universities’ courtyard in Hong Kong,
Innocent faces, blood has stained the children that did nothing wrong,
Many of these young ones, beaten, assassinated, and forced to die…
